summary: This is an email chain from August 10, 2019, discussing Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and mental health status at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It details his suicide risk assessments, a likely suicide attempt, and plans for a team to conduct a reconstruction of the events leading to his death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email; details his incarceration, suicide risk assessments, and a likely suicide attempt while housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York.

events.title: Epstein's Intake to MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was taken into custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

events.title: Epstein's Suicide Risk Assessments and Watch
events.description: Epstein received four suicide risk assessments. One resulted in a one-day suicide watch following a likely suicide attempt. He was later placed on psychological observation for a week.

events.title: Removed from Psychological Observation
events.description: Epstein was taken off psychological observation.

events.title: Follow-up Assessment
events.description: Epstein was seen again by staff the day after being taken off psychological observation.

events.title: Court Return and Suicidal Ideation Note
events.description: Epstein returned from court and a USMS form noted suicidal ideation, prompting another suicide assessment, though he was not placed on watch.

events.title: Last Assessment Before Death
events.description: Epstein was last seen by staff, with no significant concerns noted at that time.

events.title: Planned Reconstruction Team Deployment
events.description: A team was planned to go on Tuesday (August 13, 2019) to conduct a reconstruction, with participation from an expert in sex offenders.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) with a cellmate at MCC New York.
From his intake on July 8, 2019, Epstein received four suicide risk assessments.
One assessment resulted in a one-day suicide watch following a 'likely attempt' at suicide.
After the watch, he spent a week on psychological observation before being taken off on July 30.
A team was being assembled to conduct a reconstruction of the events, including a sex offender expert, planned for August 13, 2019.
